ThingDef.label: Gutted Corpse
ThingDef.description: A fresh corpse, gutted and maimed. It is too mangled and mutilated to identify what it previously was. It doesn't look appealing as a food source.

ThingDef.label: Raptor Egg (Fertilized)
ThingDef.description: A fertilized egg of a Raptor. If all goes well, it should hatch into a Baby Raptor. Eggs can be eaten raw, but are much better when cooked.

ThingDef.label: Lacosdile Egg (Fertilized)
ThingDef.description: A fertilized egg of a Lacosdile. If all goes well, it should hatch into a Baby Lacosdile. Eggs can be eaten raw, but are much better when cooked.

ThingDef.label: Hay
ThingDef.description: Hay is nutrient-rich grasses and shoots, harvested and compacted for storage. Hay is for good animal feed, but is inedible for humans.

ThingDef.label: Silage
ThingDef.description: Silage is nutrient-rich fermented hay and raw food product suitable for animal feed. The fermentation process preserves the silage and prevents it from rotting.

ThingDef.label: Hops
ThingDef.description: Hops are flowers and seed cones of a Hops Plant. They are necessary as a flavoring and preserving agent for brewing beer.

ThingDef.label: Potatoes
ThingDef.description: Potatoes are a starchy, tuberous crop of a Potato Plant. They are not very tasty when eaten raw but they do grow quickly.

ThingDef.label: Corn
ThingDef.description: Corn comes from the Corn Plant. The leafy stalk of the plant produces ears which contain the grain. Corn can be cooked for food or made into Ethanol Fuel. Corn is also known as Maize.

ThingDef.label: Rice
ThingDef.description: Rice are the small edible seeds of the Rice Plant. Not enjoyable when eaten raw, as the seeds are hard and numerous. It is a quick growing food source that can also be used for Ethanol Fuel or the alcoholic drink called Sake.

ThingDef.label: Strawberries
ThingDef.description: Strawberries are small, red, soft fruits of a Strawberry Plant. They are good when eaten raw.

ThingDef.label: Agave Fruit
ThingDef.description: The Agave Fruit is edible stalks and flowers of a wild Agave Plant. Agave Plants are native to deserts. The fruits are foul when eaten raw.

ThingDef.label: Eggplant Fruit
ThingDef.description: A large, purple, egg-shaped fruit of the Eggplant Bush. Eggplant is related to the plants of tomatoes, potatoes and tobacco, which makes it repulsive when eaten raw.

ThingDef.label: Pumpkin
ThingDef.description: A Pumpkin is a large, orange squash of the Pumpkin Vine. It has a thick shell that contains the seeds and pulp. Pumpkins are often carved to ward off ghosts. Unlikable when eaten raw but the fleshy inside is great for baking into pies.

ThingDef.label: Bean Pod
ThingDef.description: Bean Pods are the edible seeds of the Bean Plant. They can be used for cooking or for making BioDiesel Fuel. Unpleasant when eaten raw.

ThingDef.label: Tomatoes
ThingDef.description: Tomatoes are round, palm sized, red, sharp-tasting fruits of the Tomato Vine. It is useful in cooking and is enjoyable to eat even when raw.

ThingDef.label: Lettuce
ThingDef.description: Lettuce is the edible leaves of the Lettuce Plant. It is an essential part in many salads. Enjoyable to eat even when raw.

ThingDef.label: Carrots
ThingDef.description: Carrots are long, crunchy, orange root vegetables of the Carrot Plant. Refreshing when eaten raw.

ThingDef.label: Raw Champignon
ThingDef.description: Raw Champignon are small white or brown edible caps of the Champignon Mushroom. The caps are round in appearance. Unsavory when eaten raw, as the texture is similar to raw meat.

ThingDef.label: Apples
ThingDef.description: Apples are a round, red fruit that grows on Apple Trees. Commonly used in cooking for deserts due to its sweet taste, it can also be brewed into Apple Cider. Delectable to eat even when raw.

ThingDef.label: Banana
ThingDef.description: A Banana is a long, soft, yellow, sweet fruit that grows on Banana Trees. Yummy to eat when raw.

ThingDef.label: Grapes
ThingDef.description: Grapes are small, sweet, berry fruits that grow in clusters on Grape Vines. Tantalizing to eat even when raw.

ThingDef.label: Orange
ThingDef.description: Oranges are a sweet, citric fruit that grows on Orange Trees. A tough outer rind protects the soft pulpy flesh inside. Pleasant to eat when raw.

ThingDef.label: Peach
ThingDef.description: Peaches are a soft, fuzzy, sweet fruit that grows on Peach Trees. They have a large, hard pit at the core of the fruit. Splendid to eat when raw.

ThingDef.label: Blueberry
ThingDef.description: Blueberries are blue, tiny, round, berry fruits that grow on Blueberry Bushes. Often used in desserts, like Blueberry Pie. Lovely to eat when raw.

ThingDef.label: Gooseberry
ThingDef.description: Gooseberries are small, sweet, somewhat hairy fruits that grow on Gooseberry Vines. Okay to eat when raw.

ThingDef.label: Cloudberry
ThingDef.description: Cloudberries are small, amber colored, sweet, raspberry-like fruits that grow on Cloudberry Plants. Marevlous to eat when raw.

ThingDef.label: Wheat
ThingDef.description: Wheat is a cereal grain. It can be milled into Flour for use in baking bread.

ThingDef.label: Oats
ThingDef.description: Oats are a cereal grain commonly used for livestock feed or they can be cooked for food.

ThingDef.label: Cocoa Beans
ThingDef.description: Cocoa Beans are the seeds of cocoa pods from a Cocoa Tree. They can be refined into chocolate.

ThingDef.label: Sugarcane
ThingDef.description: Sugarcane is a type of long grass from the Sugarcane Plant. The grass stalks are rich in sucrose, which can be milled to produce Sugar.

ThingDef.label: Tobacco Leaves
ThingDef.description: Raw Tobacco Leaves from a Tobacco Plant. Not recommended for eating. Tobacco can be rolled and smoked as a stimulating drug. They are addicting and are associated with a number of health problems for long term use.

ThingDef.label: Coffee Beans
ThingDef.description: Raw Coffee Beans from a Coffee Plant. When roasted with water, they make for a delicious beverage called Coffee.

ThingDef.label: Tea Leaves
ThingDef.description: Tea Leaves from a Tea Shrub. When brewed with water, it produces a relaxing beverage called Tea.

ThingDef.label: Rainbow Petals
ThingDef.description: A small bundle of multi-colored petals from Spectago Flowers. It can be brewed for Spectago Tea or processed into paint for Painting Supplies.

ThingDef.label: Herb Medicine Kit
ThingDef.description: A small pack of mixed herbs. It is less potent than industrial pharmaceuticals.

ThingDef.label: Aloe Leaves
ThingDef.description: A bundle of Aloe Leaves from an Aloe Plant. Aloe Leaves are used as a type of natural medicine.

ThingDef.label: Caoutchouc
ThingDef.description: Caoutchouc is a natural rubber sap collected from a Hevea Tree. It can be vulcanized to create useful rubber materials.

ThingDef.label: Sugar
ThingDef.description: Sugar is the milled product of Sugarcanes. It is used in baking, typically for desserts and candies.

ThingDef.label: Flour
ThingDef.description: Flour ground from raw Wheat or Oats. It can be used for baking breads.

ThingDef.label: Milk
ThingDef.description: Milk is a pale liquid produced by the mammary glands of mammals. It can be consumed as a beverage.

ThingDef.label: Soy Milk
ThingDef.description: Soy Milk is a pale liquid produced from grinding Beans. It is similar to an animal's Milk, just produced from plants instead.

ThingDef.label: Tofu
ThingDef.description: Raw protein-rich Tofu, produced from Bean Pods. Acceptable to eat when raw.

ThingDef.label: Wild Rose
ThingDef.description: Wild Roses are the red flowers of a Wild Rose Plant. The plant is also known as the Prickly Rose, Bristly Rose and Arctic Rose.

ThingDef.label: Hypericum
ThingDef.description: Hypericum is a type of medicinal flower of the Hypericum Plant. This plant is well-known by its herbal name, the St. John's Wort. Researchers have discovered that Hypericum alters brain chemistry in a way which improves mood.

ThingDef.label: Mint Leaves
ThingDef.description: Mints Leaves are aromatic, leafy herbs of a Mint Plant.

ThingDef.label: Onion
ThingDef.description: Onions are the vegetable bulbs of Onion Plants. Considered to be a luxury crop, Onions are used in savory food dishes. A pungeant chemcial is released when Onions are chopped that can make you cry!

ThingDef.label: Beef
ThingDef.description: Beef is a category of meat that comes from bovine-like animals. Domestic Cows, Muffalo and Alphamuffalo produce Beef when butchered. Beef is a tender, lean meat with a decent fat content. It makes for good roasts and steaks.

ThingDef.label: Dog Meat
ThingDef.description: Dog Meat is a fatty, protein rich meat from breeds of canines. Labradror Retrievers, Yorkshire Terriers, Rimdogs, Rimwolves, Furxes, Samoyed, Border Collies, German Shepherds, Huskies and Wargs are canines.

ThingDef.label: Human Flesh
ThingDef.description: This is the soft flesh of a Human that was butchered. You would have to be a Psychopath to want to butcher humans without remorse. A Cannibal would find this flesh a delicate treat to eat.

ThingDef.label: Narn Flesh
ThingDef.description: This is the soft flesh of a Narn that was butchered. You would have to be a Psychopath to want to butcher humans without remorse. A Cannibal would find this flesh an exquisite treat to eat.

ThingDef.label: Norbal Flesh
ThingDef.description: This is the soft flesh of a Norbal that was butchered. You would have to be a Psychopath to want to butcher humans without remorse. A Cannibal would find this flesh a superb treat to eat.

ThingDef.label: Nova Flesh
ThingDef.description: This is the soft flesh of a Nova that was butchered. You would have to be a Psychopath to want to butcher humans without remorse. A Cannibal would find this flesh a splendid treat to eat.

ThingDef.label: Insectoid Meat
ThingDef.description: This is greasy, oily and squishy meat of insectoid-type creatures. It doesn't look too appealing. This meat comes from butchered Antis, Crashbug, Feralisk, Flea, Fly, Gnawler, Megascarab, Mosquito, Scorpion, Spindlecrib, Tarantula and Terramorph.

ThingDef.label: Pork
ThingDef.description: Pork is the meat category from pig-like animals. It is fatty, rich in protein and high in cholesterol. Pork chops, roasts and bacon are common meal items. Domestic Pigs, Wild Boars and Quadhogs produce Pork when butchered.

ThingDef.label: Poultry
ThingDef.description: This is the tender, raw flesh of a bird. Chickens produce poultry when butchered. It is said that everything tastes like Chicken, but many meat-loving consumers would disagree.

ThingDef.label: Reptile Meat
ThingDef.description: This is the tough muscle meat belonging to a reptilian creature. Cobra, Iguana, Lacosdile and Tortoise produce Reptile Meat when butchered.

ThingDef.label: Rodent Meat
ThingDef.description: This is the raw meat of a rodent-like animal. Alphabeavers, Chinchillas, Capybaras, Hares, Hedgehogs, Squirrels

ThingDef.label: Venison
ThingDef.description: Venison is a category of very lean meats from game animals. Alpaca, Deer, Dromedary and Elk produce Venison when butchered. This meat is great when cooked into Jerky.

ThingDef.label: Elephant Meat
ThingDef.description: This is the soft, raw flesh of a Elephant.

ThingDef.label: Feathered Raptor Meat
ThingDef.description: This is the soft, rare, exotic flesh of a Feathered Raptor.

ThingDef.label: Feenix Meat
ThingDef.description: This is the soft, raw flesh of a Feenix.

ThingDef.label: Fenrir Meat
ThingDef.description: This is the soft, raw flesh of a Fenrir.

ThingDef.label: Icicat Meat
ThingDef.description: This is the soft, raw flesh of an Icicat.

ThingDef.label: Lion Meat
ThingDef.description: This is the soft, raw flesh of a Lion.

ThingDef.label: Monkey Meat
ThingDef.description: This is the soft, raw flesh of a Monkey.

ThingDef.label: Rhinoceros Meat
ThingDef.description: This is the soft, raw flesh of a Rhinoceros.

ThingDef.label: Mutton
ThingDef.description: This is the soft, raw flesh of a Rimram.

ThingDef.label: Snork Meat
ThingDef.description: This is the soft, blubbery raw flesh of a Snork.

ThingDef.label: Thrumbo Meat
ThingDef.description: This is the soft, raw flesh of a Thrumbo.
